title: Regulates hazardous substance storage facilities
summary: Provides that any person storing a hazardous substance shall furnish the department of environmental conservation with information on the storage facility, repairs or replacements, hazardous substances stored, storage and handling practices, or results of tests, monitoring and inspections.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2723

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 20, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of A. CLARK, COLTON -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Environmental Conservation

       AN ACT to amend the  environmental  conservation  law,  in  relation  to
         hazardous substance storage facilities

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 10 of  section  40-0105  of  the  environmental
    2  conservation  law,  as  amended  by  chapter 334 of the laws of 2008, is
    3  amended to read as follows:
    4    10. "Storage facility"  or  "facility"  means  a  single  property  or
    5  contiguous  or  adjacent  properties used for a common purpose which are
    6  owned or operated by the same person on or in which are located  one  or
    7  more  NON-STATIONARY  tanks,  BARRELS,  DRUMS,  OR OTHER HOLDING VESSELS
    8  which are used for the storage or containment of hazardous substances.
    9    S 2. Subdivision 2 of section 40-0109 of the  environmental  conserva-
   10  tion  law,  as  added  by chapter 672 of the laws of 1986, is amended to
   11  read as follows:
   12    2. Any person storing a hazardous substance [may be required to] SHALL
   13  furnish the department with information on the storage facility, repairs
   14  or replacements, hazardous substances stored, storage and handling prac-
   15  tices, or results of tests, monitoring and inspections.
   16    S 3. This act shall take effect on the thirtieth day  after  it  shall
   17  have become a law.



        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
